text: The 2002-03 Austrian football championship was organized by the Austrian Football Bundesliga. The second league was called Red Zac-Erste Liga. The third performance level was represented by the regional leagues East (Vienna, Lower Austria, Burgenland), Middle (Upper Austria, Styria, Carinthia) and West (Salzburg, Tyrol, Vorarlberg). FK Austria Wien became champion for the 22nd time. Their last title win was in 1993. In addition, the Viennese also won their 24th cup victory this season. Despite these great successes, the club parted ways with its coach Walter Schachner during the season because they wanted to take the opportunity to recruit Christoph Daum as coach. Andreas Ivanschitz (SK Rapid), Dieter Ramusch (Grazer AK) and Szabolcs Safar (SV Austria Salzburg) played all 36 matches in the league. ==Final table== Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. Rushfeldt (25/5); Christian Mayrleb (3/2) * Coaches: Walter Schachner / Christoph Daum ==Top scorer== Name Club Goals Axel Lawarée Schwarz-Weiß Bregenz 21 Eduard Glieder SV Pasching 16 Marijo Maric FC Kärnten 16 Vladimir Janocko FK Austria Wien 12 Austria Soccer ==Regionalliga champions == *Regional league Eastː SV Schwechat *Regional league Middleː Blau-Weiß Linz *Regional league Westː SPG WSG Wattens/FC Wacker Tirol Relegation matches : BSV Bad Bleiberg only managed to prevail against FC Blau-Weiß Linz in the relegation playoffs on away goals. After the relegation playoffs, the club was acquired by FC Kärnten due to financial difficulties and played under the new name BSV Junios Villach in the First League. SPG WSG Wattens/FC Wacker Tirol secured promotion to the First League with an aggregate score of 3-2 against SV Schwechat. After the relegation playoffs, the joint team was dissolved. FC Wacker Tirol claimed the right to promotion to the First League, while WSG Wattens played in the Tyrolean League. ==References== Category:Football in Austria Category:Football seasons
title: 2002-03 Austrian football championship
